position.marginalia_text: Theorica ac praxis Terminatio recepientium est mutatio naturarum receptarum, per ineffabilem mixtionem calidi, [id est], Ignis, cu[m] Frigido: humidi, [id est], Aqua[e] cu[m] Sicco, dispositione perpetua. Ha[e]c perpetua dispositio est fumus Albus: & est Aqua albificans indicu[m] lapide[m], vt ait Maria. Ha[e]c res est aqua albificans indrademum lapidem. [Id est] Indicum. Et ista aqua est aqua vina, qua[e] sicca dicitur, vt omnes asserunt. Et est Argentum vinum Sapientum, de quo dixit Hermes: Custodite hoc argumentu[m] vinu[m] coagulatu[m], quod est in intimis thalamis in quibus coagulatu[m] est. Ipsu[m] enim argentum vinu[m] est de Corde SatVRNI, & est secretu[m] scolia[e], & d[icitu]r Terra residua

marginalia.translation: Theory and practice The termination of the receiving is a change in the nature of the received through an indescribable comixture of the hot, that is, fire, with the cold; humid, that is, water, with the cold, in a lasting disposition. This constant disposition is white smoke and water whitening Indian stone, as Mary the Jewess says. This thing is water whitening the indrademum stone, that is, the Indian stone. And this particular water is wine water, which is described as dr, as everyone asserts.
